statlines.name: Camel Truck
statlines.rules: Available to North, South, Peace River, NuCoal, Leagueless and Black Talon. The transport option on the Camel Truck is not enclosed. Models being transported can interact with the battlefield normally from their position on the back of the model. While being transported: - These models will be treated as an additional component of the Camel Truck and are considered to be on the back of the model. - They may attack and may be attacked. LOS and range is deteremined from their location on the back of the model. - They are considered to have partial cover while being transported. - They use the transport's speed as their own."

statlines.name: Demo Drone
statlines.rules: After the Demo Drone uses its weapon, it is destroyed and removed from the battlefield. Demo Drones destroyed in this way do not count towards an opponents victory points, such as from Pave the Way or Wipe Them Out. The Demo Drone may designate one enemy model as the primary target if it is in base contact with that model. Universal drones are only available to North, South, Peace River, NuCoal, Leagueless and Black Talon. Any one type of universal drone may only be selected up to five times for any one force.

statlines.name: + Second-in-Command
statlines.rules: You may upgrade one non-CGL model in each combat group to 2iC for 1 TV.

statlines.name: + Force Leader
statlines.rules: The highest-ranking commander in your force at any given time becomes the force leader. The force leaders initiative is used for initiative rolls. If your force does not have any officers, your force leader will be one CGL of your choosing. If the force leader is destroyed, the next highest ranking commander in the force becomes the force leader. The Chain of Command table shows the rank from highest to lowest.

statlines.name: + Anti-air gun upgrade
statlines.rules: *AC, *RC or *LC: add AA trait. Up to 2 models per primary unit may have this or the AA missile upgrade.

statlines.name: + Anti-air missile upgrade
statlines.rules: *ATM changed to *AAM. Up to 2 models per primary unit may have this or the AA gun upgrade.

statlines.name: + Sidearms: LP
statlines.rules: Only models with the Hands trait can purchase sidearms. Up to 2 models may purchase Light Pistols (LP) or Light Submachine Guns (LSMG) for 1 TV total. These weapons come with the React trait.

statlines.name: + Vet: Improved Gunnery (A:1)
statlines.rules: Increase the gunnery (GU) skill by +1 (Max 2+) for 2 TV per Action that the models has, i.e. a model with 3 Actions will pay 6 TV for this upgrade.

statlines.name: + Vet: Dual Guns (Medium)
statlines.rules: Add the Link trait to one light or medium; pistol, submachine gun, autocannon, frag cannon, flamer or grenade launcher with the React trait for 1 TV. - This upgrade cannot be added to combo weapons such as a LAC/LGL. For modeling purposes, this adds a second pistol, submachine gun, autocannon, frag cannon, flamer or grenade launcher to the model. Having linked weapons on a gear is normally represented as having two of the same weapon, one in each hand.

statlines.name: + Vet: ECCM
statlines.rules: Add the ECCM trait to a gear, vehicle or strider for 1 TV.

statlines.name: + Vet: Brawler (Brawl:1)
statlines.rules: Add the brawl:1 trait or increase an existing Brawl trait by +1 for 1 TV. This model may also add the Brawl:2 trait or increase the Brawl trait by 2 for 2 TV.

statlines.name: + Vet: Brawler (Brawl:2)
statlines.rules: Add the brawl:1 trait or increase an existing Brawl trait by +1 for 1 TV. This model may also add the Brawl:2 trait or increase the Brawl trait by 2 for 2 TV.

statlines.name: + Vet: Reach (VB)
statlines.rules: Add the Reach:1 trait to one vibro-blade, spike gun, combat weapon or infantry combat weapon with the React trait for 1 TV. If the weapon already has the Reach trait, then increase it by +1.

statlines.name: + Vet: Reach (SG)
statlines.rules: Add the Reach:1 trait to one vibro-blade, spike gun, combat weapon or infantry combat weapon with the React trait for 1 TV. If the weapon already has the Reach trait, then increase it by +1.

statlines.name: + Vet: Reach (CW)
statlines.rules: Add the Reach:1 trait to one vibro-blade, spike gun, combat weapon or infantry combat weapon with the React trait for 1 TV. If the weapon already has the Reach trait, then increase it by +1.

statlines.name: + Vet: Reach (ICW)
statlines.rules: Add the Reach:1 trait to one vibro-blade, spike gun, combat weapon or infantry combat weapon with the React trait for 1 TV. If the weapon already has the Reach trait, then increase it by +1.

statlines.name: + Vet: Reach (Medium)
statlines.rules: Add the Reach:1 trait to one vibro-blade, spike gun, combat weapon or infantry combat weapon with the React trait for 1 TV. If the weapon already has the Reach trait, then increase it by +1.

statlines.name: + Vet: Melee Upgrade LVB (React, Precise)
statlines.rules: One gear with a melee weapon, that has the React trait, can upgrade it to one of the following: LVB (React, Precise) or LCW (React, Brawl:1)

statlines.name: + Vet: Remove Vuln:H

statlines.name: + Vet: Remove Vuln:F

statlines.name: + Vet: Remove Vuln:C

statlines.name: + Vet: FieldArmor (AR 7 or 8)

statlines.name: + Vet: FieldArmor (AR 9 or 10)

statlines.name: + Vet: FieldArmor (AR 11 or 12)

statlines.name: + Vet: AMS

statlines.name: + Duelist
statlines.rules: You may choose one gear in your force to be a duelist. The duelist must purchase the Vet trait if the model does not already have it. They are not required to be placed in a veteran combat group. A duelist may purchase standard and veteran upgrades as well as any duelist upgrades.

statlines.name: + Duelist for Vet

tooltips.LAC: L Autocannon 6-18/36 Dmg:6 OR:(Burst:1,Split), OR:(Precise) D
tooltips.OR:(Burst:1,Split): This trait is always accompanied by multiple ammunition types or additional firing modes. The player must choose one type to use when attacking.
tooltips.OR:(Precise): This trait is always accompanied by multiple ammunition types or additional firing modes. The player must choose one type to use when attacking.
tooltips.LVB: L Vibro Blade 0/- Dmg:7 AP:2 M
tooltips.AP:2: Weapons with the AP:X trait always deal at least one point of damage on a successful hit. In addition, Armor Piercing weapons have a minimum damage that is dealt on a successful hit. Minimum Damage: the attack MOS or the trait rating X, whichever is lower. If regular damage calculations would result in more damage, then that may be used instead.
tooltips.LRP: L Rocket Pack 6-18/36 Dmg:7 AOE:3, AP:1 D, I
tooltips.AOE:3: Weapons with the AOE:X trait may be used to attack an area with a radius of X inches around a target point. You will need to declare a target point and measure radius from there. All models in the radius, friend or foe, become targets. If the attack is centered on one model, then that model becomes the primary target. All other models within the area are considered secondary targets. Attack rolls against secondary targets have a -1d6 modifier. One opposed roll is performed for each targeted model. An AOE attack may target a point on the battlefield instead of a model (i.e., to maximize the number of secondary targets). There is no need to roll against a target point. It is automatic. If the attack is indirect (sensor locked, or forward observed), then it goes over any intervening terrain and is only blocked by overhanging cover that may be above a target model. More specifically, full medium or heavy overhanging cover because attacks will normally go through light cover (tree branches do not stop munitions). If the attack is direct (LOS or sensor lock), then targets behind full medium or heavy cover cannot be hit. For example, a model completely behind a large rock, from the perspective of the shooter, cannot be hit by a rocket pack fired directly because the large rock is in the way. This will more commonly only apply to secondary targets because you would normally have LOS to a primary target if you were shooting at it directly. One exception to that would be if you shoot through full light cover at a target which you have sensor locked.
tooltips.AP:1: Weapons with the AP:X trait always deal at least one point of damage on a successful hit. In addition, Armor Piercing weapons have a minimum damage that is dealt on a successful hit. Minimum Damage: the attack MOS or the trait rating X, whichever is lower. If regular damage calculations would result in more damage, then that may be used instead.
tooltips.LAPGL: L Anti-Per Grenade Launchers 0-3/- Dmg:5 AI, Frag, Prox D
tooltips.AI: Weapons with the AI trait may deal more than two damage to infantry on a successful attack. These weapons also have a bonus of +1D6 against infantry and cavalry models.
tooltips.Frag: Weapons with the Frag trait add a +2D6 modifier to attack rolls.
tooltips.Prox: Weapons with the Prox trait may be used to perform a direct attack against all models around this model, within the weapons listed range. - All possible targets (friend or foe) are considered primary targets. - This weapon cannot be used to attack elevated VTOLs unless the model using it is also an elevated VTOL. - Elevated VTOLs cannot use this weapon to attack non-elevated VTOLs. - This weapon cannot be used to attack buildings, terrain or area terrain.
tooltips.Hands: This model has additional upgrade options available and limited climbing ability (see Climbing, p. 30).
tooltips.MAC: M Autocannon 6-18/36 Dmg:7 OR:(Burst:1,Split), OR:(Precise) D
tooltips.MFC: M Frag Cannon 3-9/18 Dmg:6 OR:(AP:2,Precise), OR:(Frag,AI) D
tooltips.OR:(AP:2,Precise): This trait is always accompanied by multiple ammunition types or additional firing modes. The player must choose one type to use when attacking.
tooltips.OR:(Frag,AI): This trait is always accompanied by multiple ammunition types or additional firing modes. The player must choose one type to use when attacking.
tooltips.MSC: M Snub Cannon 3-9/18 Dmg:9 AP:3, Demo:3 D
tooltips.AP:3: Weapons with the AP:X trait always deal at least one point of damage on a successful hit. In addition, Armor Piercing weapons have a minimum damage that is dealt on a successful hit. Minimum Damage: the attack MOS or the trait rating X, whichever is lower. If regular damage calculations would result in more damage, then that may be used instead.
tooltips.Demo:3: A weapon with the Demo:X trait will allow certain weapons to damage buildings, terrain and fortifications more efficiently. When attacking a building, terrain or fortification, if the margin of success is 0 (MOS:0) or better the weapon will do the amount of damage equal to X. If regular damage calculations would result in more damage, then that may be used instead.

tooltips.Field Armor: This model suffers one less damage from each attack to a minimum of one damage. For infantry specifically, the damage reduction due to field armor applies after the two damage limit of the infantry unit type.

tooltips.AOE:2: Weapons with the AOE:X trait may be used to attack an area with a radius of X inches around a target point. You will need to declare a target point and measure radius from there. All models in the radius, friend or foe, become targets. If the attack is centered on one model, then that model becomes the primary target. All other models within the area are considered secondary targets. Attack rolls against secondary targets have a -1d6 modifier. One opposed roll is performed for each targeted model. An AOE attack may target a point on the battlefield instead of a model (i.e., to maximize the number of secondary targets). There is no need to roll against a target point. It is automatic. If the attack is indirect (sensor locked, or forward observed), then it goes over any intervening terrain and is only blocked by overhanging cover that may be above a target model. More specifically, full medium or heavy overhanging cover because attacks will normally go through light cover (tree branches do not stop munitions). If the attack is direct (LOS or sensor lock), then targets behind full medium or heavy cover cannot be hit. For example, a model completely behind a large rock, from the perspective of the shooter, cannot be hit by a rocket pack fired directly because the large rock is in the way. This will more commonly only apply to secondary targets because you would normally have LOS to a primary target if you were shooting at it directly. One exception to that would be if you shoot through full light cover at a target which you have sensor locked.
tooltips.Climber: This trait allows a model to climb terrain features at its full move rate.
tooltips.Vet: This model is a veteran. It has one skill point and may purchase upgrades from the standard and veteran upgrade lists.
tooltips.LSG: L Spike Gun 0/- Dmg:6 AP:3 M
tooltips.Airdrop: Combat groups composed entirely of models with the Airdrop trait may deploy using the airdrop deployment option. See Airdrop Deployment.
tooltips.Comms: Commanders with the Comms trait do not need to roll for orders, when all the recipients of the order are in formation with this model. They will still have to roll an opposed roll when there are jamming attempts made against their orders. Also, if a roll is required, due to one of the models being out of formation, and the roll fails, then the order fails for all models in its entirety. Commanders in formation with a model that has the Comms trait may use the Comms trait of that model and their EW skill in place of their own when issuing orders.

tooltips.ECCM (Aux): This model is equipped with an electronic counter-countermeasure system. This model and all friendly models within 6 inches gain +1D6 to all EW rolls. This effect is not cumulative with additional ECCM traits.

tooltips.Medic: Medics may use the patch action. A medic may not use an attack action, be a forward observer, use ECM or ECCM traits for ECM attacks, ECM jamming and firewalls, or perform detailed scans. However, they may retaliate if they are fired upon. A medic may not capture objectives, be an objective, or be any type of leader or commander.

Smoke that partially or fully obscures a targets silhouette provides a +1D6 bonus to defense rolls against ranged attacks. Models with LOS that are within one inch of each other ignore any intervening smoke. The smoke area does not follow a model during movement. Remove the smoke marker during the cleanup phase.

tooltips.Comms (Aux): Commanders with the Comms trait do not need to roll for orders, when all the recipients of the order are in formation with this model. They will still have to roll an opposed roll when there are jamming attempts made against their orders. Commanders in formation with a model that has the Comms trait may use the Comms trait of that model and their EW skill in place of their own when issuing orders.

tooltips.Towed: One model with this trait may be towed behind a gear, strider or vehicle with the W or G movement type. Models with the VTOL trait cannot be used to tow. Towing uses the rules for transports with the following exceptions: - The towing model cannot move more than 6 inches per move. - The towed model is placed behind the model towing it, facing aft. It does not go inside a transport. - The towed model may be attacked normally. - The towed model cannot perform any Actions while being towed.

tooltips.Occupancy:2 Squads: The Occupancy:X trait is used during deployment. Buildings with this trait will specify the type and amount of other models which may be inside it during its deployment. By default, this trait also lets you know how many models can fit inside a building sold by DP9. Squads: This model may hold up to X infantry squads. - 3 Infantry teams, infantry singles, or drones may be substituted in place of one infantry squad. Models do not have to spend actions to enter or exit buildings.
tooltips.Stationary: This model is always braced and cannot move or turn. This model may not perform hide actions or evade reactions.

tooltips.TFC: One CGL in the force may be designated a Task Force Commander for 5 TV. Has one CP, Initiative Skill 3+ and highest rank.
tooltips.Rank:5: Commander rank, Force Commander must be chosen from the highest ranking commanders remaining.
tooltips.CO: One CGL in the force may be upgraded to a Commanding Officer (CO) for 3 TV. Has one CP, Initiative Skill 4+ and second highest rank after TFC.
tooltips.Rank:4: Commander rank, Force Commander must be chosen from the highest ranking commanders remaining.
tooltips.XO: One CGL in the force may be upgraded to a Executive Officer (XO) for 3 TV. Has one CP, Initiative Skill 4+ and third highest rank after TFC and CO.
tooltips.Rank:3: Commander rank, Force Commander must be chosen from the highest ranking commanders remaining.
tooltips.CGL: One model in each combat group must be selected to be the CGL. This is a free upgrade. Has one CP, Initiative Skill 5+ and fourth highest rank after TFC, CO and XO.
tooltips.Rank:2: Commander rank, Force Commander must be chosen from the highest ranking commanders remaining.
tooltips.2iC: You may upgrade one non-CGL model in any combat group to Second in Command (2iC) for an 1 TV. Has one CP, Initiative Skill 5+ and is the lowest rank commander model.
tooltips.Rank:1: Commander rank, Force Commander must be chosen from the highest ranking commanders remaining.
tooltips.FL: The highest-ranking commander in your force at any given time becomes the force leader. The force leaders initiative is used for initiative rolls. If your force does not have any officers, your force leader will be one CGL of your choosing. If the force leader is destroyed, the next highest ranking commander in the force becomes the force leader. The Chain of Command table shows the rank from highest to lowest.
tooltips.AAM: Anti-Air Missile 12-36/72 Dmg:0 Flak, Guided D, I
tooltips.SP:1: This models gains 1 skill point in addition to any it may have from other sources. If the model is a commander, it instead gains 1 command point.
tooltips.Brawl:+1: A Brawl:X trait on a weapon will modify attack rolls by XD6 when using that weapon. A Brawl:X trait on a model will modify all melee rolls that model makes by XD6. Multiple instances of the Brawl:X trait are cumulative.
tooltips.Brawl:+2: A Brawl:X trait on a weapon will modify attack rolls by XD6 when using that weapon. A Brawl:X trait on a model will modify all melee rolls that model makes by XD6. Multiple instances of the Brawl:X trait are cumulative.
tooltips.Reach:+1: This melee weapon can attack a target X inches from its base. This is not a ranged attack.
tooltips.Resist:C: This model does not receive the extra damage from Corrosion.
tooltips.Duelist: This model may select upgrades from the standard, veteran and duelist upgrade list. This model also uses the Independent Operator and Lead by Example rules (see Duelist Upgrades on page 49).
tooltips.LBE: If you select the Lead by Example option, your duelist will gain the following ability during the game. - Once per round, for each duelist, whenever a duelist damages an enemy model, give one SP to one model in formation with the duelist. - This SP does not convert to a CP. If not used, this SP is removed during cleanup.
tooltips.IO: If you select the Independent Operator option, the duelist will be in a combat group all by itself. - Select a role to be used as you would normally do for a primary unit of a combat group. This role may be used to select objectives. - The independent operator may not be a CGL or 2iC. However, they may be upgraded to a XO, CO, or TFC.
tooltips.LP (Link, Split, NoSplitPenalty, Range:0: L Pistol 0-24/48 Dmg:6 Precise, Link, Split, NoSplitPenalty, Range:0-24/48 D
tooltips.NoSplitPenalty: This model does not suffer the -1D6 modifier when using the Split trait for attacks made with this weapon.
tooltips.Range:0-24/48: Use this weapon range instead of the normal one.
tooltips.Shield:1: This model may reroll defense rolls if the attacker is within its front arc.
tooltips.DUCS: Extendedd Content: Armored Might: Models in this group may purchase the Field Armor Veteran Upgrade, without being upgraded to Veterans. The combat group is the SK role, regardless of the role of any of its members. This combat group may be used in any Northern army.
tooltips.WeF: Two models in each combat group may purchase one veteran upgrade without making them veterans.
tooltips.BC: You may select one non-commander gear to be a Battle Chaplain (BC) for 2 TV. The BC becomes an officer and can take the place as a third commander within a combat group. The BC has 1 CP and can use it to give orders to any combat group in the force. BCs will only be used to roll for initiative if there are no other commanders in the force. When there are no other commanders in the force, the BC will roll with a 5+ initiative skill.
tooltips.MVB (React, Reach:2): M Vibro Blade 0-2/- Dmg:8 AP:3, Reach:2 M
tooltips.LVB (React, Precise): L Vibro Blade 0/- Dmg:7 AP:2, Precise M
tooltips.PO: MILICIA may select one non-commander to be a Political Officer (PO) for 2 TV. The PO becomes a commander and can take the place as a third commander within a combat group. The PO has 1 CP and can use it to give orders to any combat group in the force. POs will only be used to roll for initiative if there are no other commanders in the force, in which case it will roll with a 5+ initiative skill.
tooltips.Shield+: MP models within one combat group may purchase the Shield+ trait for 1 TV each. The Shield+ trait works just like a Shield trait but also adds +1D6 to defensive rolls from attacks originating from the front arc.
tooltips.BlS: One combat group may purchase the following veteran upgrades for any models without being veterans; Improved Gunnery, Dual Guns, Brawler, Veteran Melee upgrade, or ECCM.
tooltips.TankJockey: Ignore the movement penalty for traveling through difficult terrain.
tooltips.ShO: One gear in each combat group may be a duelist. This force cannot use the Independent Operator rule for duelists.
tooltips.LLC (Link): L Laser Cannon 12-36/72 Dmg:6 Precise, Advanced, Link D
tooltips.LHTS: Extended Content: Hovertank Commander: Any commander that is in a vehicle type model may improve its EW skill by one, to a maximum of 3+, for 1 TV each. Experienced Crew: Any model given the GREL Crew upgrade may purchase a single Veteran Upgrade without making them veterans. The combat group is the SK role, regardless of the role of any of its members. This combat group may be used in any CEF army, and NuCoal forces using the PAK sublist. In PAK forces, Fusiliers may be used in place of LHT-71 or LHT-67s.
tooltips.LHTSEC: Extended Content: Experienced Crew: Any model given the GREL Crew upgrade may purchase a single Veteran Upgrade without making them veterans.
